repositories.brief_summary: String module extended with new splitting functions, opam tooling improved, and several runtime issues reported
repositories.new_features_summary: Added String.{take,drop,cut}_{first,last} functions and improved opam configuration tooling
repositories.new_features:
- **String module splitting functions** `String.take_first`, `String.take_last`, `String.drop_first`, `String.drop_last`, `String.cut_first`, and `String.cut_last` added by [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) to simplify string manipulation operations ([#14352](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14352))
- **Opam configuration tooling** enhanced with `ocaml-config.install` deployment script and historical compatibility support for system compilers by [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) ([#14351](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14351))
- **C dependency generation** fixed in otherlibs build system by [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) to properly handle compilation dependencies ([#14356](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14356))
- **Documentation formatting** corrected for polymorphic function parameters feature description by [Bozhidar Batsov](https://github.com/bbatsov) ([#14357](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14357))
repositories.activity_summary: New PRs opened for String module extensions, debugger improvements, and opam system compiler support
repositories.activity:
- **New String module extensions** proposed with `String.{take,drop,cut}_{first,last}_while` functions by [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) to complement the newly merged splitting functions ([#14362](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14362))
- **Debugger enhancements** opened by [Joel Reymont](https://github.com/joelreymont) including command history and line editing support for ocamldebug ([#14353](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14353)), though line number breakpoints proposal was closed ([#14350](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14350))
- **Opam system compiler support** expanded with two new PRs by [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) enabling trunk compiler installation ([#14354](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14354)) and branch pinning capabilities ([#14355](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14355))
- **Domain exception handling** improved in proposed PR by [Nathan Taylor](https://github.com/dijkstracula) to preserve backtraces when Domain.join raises exceptions ([#14358](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14358)), though closed pending further work
- **Ongoing type system improvements** include spellchecking hints for module errors by [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) ([#14330](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14330)), atomic class cache access by [Vincent Laviron](https://github.com/lthls) ([#14333](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14333)), and polymorphic let constraint handling by [Alistair](https://github.com/johnyob) ([#14325](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14325))
- **Runtime fixes** progressing with ephemeron marking improvements by [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) ([#14338](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14338)) and backup thread synchronization by [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) ([#14303](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14303))
- **Relocatable OCaml initiative** continues with five PRs by [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) addressing various aspects of installation portability ([#14243](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14243), [#14244](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14244), [#14245](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14245), [#14246](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14246), [#14247](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14247))
- **Platform support** expanded with Haiku native backend activation by [Anarchos](https://github.com/Sylvain78) ([#14138](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14138)) and typing recovery from Merlin by [Xavier Van de Woestyne](https://github.com/xvw) ([#14241](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14241))
repositories.discussions_summary: Discussion on String module improvements and DLS API redesign continue
repositories.notable_discussions:
- **String module enhancement proposal** by [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) discussing API design for string manipulation functions, directly related to the merged and proposed String splitting functions ([#14137](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14137))
- **DLS API redesign** discussion by [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) exploring improvements to domain-local storage mechanisms ([#13356](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13356))
- **TODO.md documentation update** proposed by [@TimeForTypes](https://github.com/TimeForTypes) for repository maintenance ([#14361](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14361))
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on standard library API expansion, improved tooling for opam integration, and runtime stability
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Standard library ergonomics** receiving attention through String module extensions that simplify common operations without requiring manual index calculations, building on community feedback about API usability
- **Opam ecosystem integration** being strengthened with improved system compiler support, historical compatibility tracking, and relocatable installation capabilities to ease distribution and deployment
- **Runtime robustness** under scrutiny with multiple segfault reports in Memprof ([#14340](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14340), [#14341](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14341)), domain shutdown ([#14319](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14319)), and ephemeron handling ([#14349](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14349))
- **Termux/Android build support** addressed with three issues closed after resolving getentropy and build system problems ([#14087](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14087), [#13380](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13380), [#14346](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14346))
- **Developer tooling improvements** proposed including debugger command history and AI contribution guidelines ([#14052](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14052))
repositories.issues_summary: Good first issue available for domain backtrace inheritance behavior
repositories.good_first_issues: - **Domain backtrace inheritance** issue asking whether `Printexc.record_backtrace true` should be inherited by new domains, labeled as good first issue by [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) with recent interest from [@dijkstracula](https://github.com/dijkstracula) who offered to work on it during holidays ([#12363](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/12363))
repositories.contributors_summary: Active contributions from Daniel Bünzli and David Allsopp on stdlib and opam tooling, plus issue reports from multiple users
repositories.contributors:
- [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) implemented String module splitting functions that were merged ([#14352](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14352)) and proposed additional while-based variants ([#14362](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14362)), plus initiated String module improvement discussion ([#14137](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14137))
- [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) merged fixes for C dependency generation ([#14356](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14356)) and opam configuration history ([#14351](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14351)), opened opam system compiler support PRs ([#14354](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14354), [#14355](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14355)), reported testsuite C++ compiler issue ([#14348](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14348)), and maintains relocatable OCaml initiative ([#14243](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14243), [#14244](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14244), [#14245](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14245), [#14246](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14246), [#14247](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14247), [#14250](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14250))
- [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) opened runtime fixes for ephemeron marking ([#14338](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14338)) and backup thread synchronization ([#14303](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14303)), authored good first issue on domain backtrace inheritance ([#12363](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/12363)), and maintains DLS API discussion ([#13356](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13356))
- [Joel Reymont](https://github.com/joelreymont) proposed debugger enhancements including command history and line editing ([#14353](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14353))
- [Nathan Taylor](https://github.com/dijkstracula) worked on Domain.join backtrace preservation ([#14358](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14358)) and expressed interest in contributing to backtrace inheritance issue ([#12363](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/12363))
- [Florian Weimer](https://github.com/fweimer) reported confusing error message with open polymorphic variants ([#14359](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14359))
- [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) reported debug assertion failure in ephemeron verification on trunk ([#14349](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14349))
- [Austin Theriault](https://github.com/ajbt200128) reported two Memprof segfault issues related to backtraces and runtime events ([#14340](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14340), [#14341](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14341))
- [Victoire](https://github.com/lupjo) requested adding effect keyword to manual ([#14345](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14345))
- [Jakub Bachurski](https://github.com/jbachurski) reported type inclusion check incompleteness ([#14343](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14343))
- [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) working on spellchecking hints for module error messages ([#14330](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14330))
- [Vincent Laviron](https://github.com/lthls) implementing atomic class cache access ([#14333](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14333))
- [Alistair](https://github.com/johnyob) developing polymorphic let constraint improvements ([#14325](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14325))
- [Bozhidar Batsov](https://github.com/bbatsov) fixed documentation formatting ([#14357](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14357))
- [Antonin Décimo](https://github.com/MisterDA) had sockaddr deprecation PR merged ([#14310](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14310))
- [Anarchos](https://github.com/Sylvain78) working on Haiku native backend ([#14138](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14138))
- [Xavier Van de Woestyne](https://github.com/xvw) integrating Merlin's typing recovery ([#14241](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14241))

repositories.brief_summary: Released opam 2.5.0~beta1 with dry-run fixes and macOS sandbox improvements
repositories.new_features_summary: Dry-run mode improvements, macOS sandbox fixes, and version-equivalent package rename bug fix
repositories.new_features:
- Fixed **`--dry-run` mode** for `opam switch create` which was incorrectly creating switch root directories and build artifacts ([#6540](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6540))
- Fixed **macOS sandbox** to allow writes in `/var/folders/` and `/var/db/mds/` directories required by macOS core tools ([#4797](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/4797), [#4389](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/4389), [#6460](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6460))
- Fixed **version-equivalent package rename bug** where renaming packages like `pkg.00` to `pkg.0` caused complete package removal ([#6774](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6774), [#6754](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6754))
- Removed **cmdliner dependency** from opam build, introducing internal `OpamCmdliner` interface ([#6755](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6755), [#6425](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6425))
- Added **2.5.0~beta1 binaries** to installation scripts ([#6795](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6795))
repositories.activity_summary: Documentation PRs under review, ongoing performance optimization work, and release preparation activities
repositories.activity:
- **Documentation improvements** in progress by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) covering compiler selection with configure-time options ([#6777](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6777), [#6645](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6645)) and default compiler selection behavior for `opam init` and `opam switch create` ([#6778](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6778), [#6407](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6407)), both awaiting updates based on review feedback from [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27)
- **Installation script improvements** by [R. Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou) updating apparmor profile handling and cleanup procedures ([#6760](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6760)) alongside **GitHub Actions workflow fix** ([#6767](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6767)) to properly run hygiene tests for shell scripts
- **Performance optimization research** continuing with repository structure redesign to use tar.gz archives directly ([#6625](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6625), [#5741](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/5741)), depext status checking at update time ([#6489](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6489), [#6461](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6461)), and benchmark expansion for larger repository diffs ([#6567](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6567), [#6561](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6561))
- **Build system hardening** with improved Makefile shell script error handling ([#6751](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6751)) and patch library update investigation for performance improvements ([#6772](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6772))
- **Bug fixes in development** addressing repository updates after version-equivalent package renames ([#6783](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6783), [#6782](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6782)) and reftest improvements for hash collision handling ([#6793](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6793))
- **Release activities** including changelog porting from 2.5 branch ([#6796](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6796)), version bumping to 2.5~beta1 ([#6791](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6791)), and CHANGES file updates ([#6787](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6787))
- **CI/CD improvements** removing unconditional Windows binary uploads ([#6771](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6771)) and renaming hygiene scripts for clarity ([#6768](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6768))
repositories.discussions_summary: Active discussions on configure option handling, depext upgrade issues, and repository caching behavior
repositories.notable_discussions:
- **Configure `--bindir` option not respected** during opam installation from source, with development team deciding to add all configure paths to opam-installer ([#6759](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6759))
- **OpenSSL version upgrade problem** with Dream dependencies where system library updates from OpenSSL 3.5.2 to 3.6.0 break existing installations, with proposed solution to use `file-depends` feature in `conf-*` packages ([#6736](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6736))
- **Repository cache invalidation issue** after git package rename where first update uses stale state, highlighting broader concerns about version-equivalent package handling across import and display operations ([#6782](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6782), [#6774](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6774))
- **`opam list --installable` semantics clarification** requested regarding how depexts affect installability determination, as current behavior returns packages depending on uninstalled depexts ([#6797](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6797))
- **Missing reftest for `file-depends` feature** noted by [R. Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou), highlighting gap in test coverage ([#6794](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6794))
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on beta release quality, performance optimization research, and improving documentation for compiler selection
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Beta release stabilization** with emphasis on fixing user-facing bugs like dry-run mode artifacts and package rename handling before opam 2.5.0 final release
- **Performance optimization exploration** spanning multiple approaches including tar.gz direct usage, incremental loading improvements, and depext checking optimizations ([#6625](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6625), [#6489](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6489), [#6567](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6567))
- **Documentation enhancement initiative** to clarify compiler selection mechanisms and configuration options, responding to user confusion about default behaviors ([#6777](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6777), [#6778](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6778))
- **Build system modernization** removing external dependencies like cmdliner and improving error handling across build tooling ([#6755](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6755), [#6751](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6751))
- **System package integration improvements** addressing real-world issues with system library updates and proposing better tracking mechanisms via `file-depends` ([#6736](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6736))
repositories.contributors_summary: Kate led release activities and multiple PRs, R. Boujbel managed release process, Hannes Mehnert fixed dry-run bug
repositories.contributors:
- [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) led the **2.5.0~beta1 release** including changelog preparation ([#6796](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6796), [#6787](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6787)), installation script updates ([#6795](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6795)), CI improvements ([#6771](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6771), [#6768](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6768)), documentation work ([#6777](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6777), [#6778](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6778)), reftest fixes ([#6793](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6793)), and ongoing performance optimization research ([#6625](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6625), [#6567](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6567), [#6772](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6772), [#6751](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6751))
- [R. Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou) managed **release coordination** including version bumping ([#6791](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6791)), installation script improvements ([#6760](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6760)), identified missing test coverage ([#6794](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6794)), and provided review comments across multiple PRs ([#6759](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6759), [#6736](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6736), [#6782](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6782), [#6787](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6787), [#6793](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6793))
- [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) fixed the **dry-run directory creation bug** preventing filesystem writes during `opam switch create --dry-run` ([#6540](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6540), [#5918](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6918))
- [@arozovyk](https://github.com/arozovyk) addressed **version-equivalent package rename bug** ([#6774](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6774)), added reftests ([#6783](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6783)), and continues work on depext performance improvements ([#6489](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6489))
- [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) provided detailed **review feedback** on documentation PRs suggesting improvements to compiler selection guides and FAQ entries ([#6777](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6777), [#6778](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6778))
- [Pau Ruiz Safont](https://github.com/psafont) raised **documentation issue** about unclear `opam list --installable` semantics ([#6797](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6797))
- [@ccxcz](https://github.com/ccxcz) reported **configure option bug** where `--bindir` is not respected during installation ([#6759](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6759))
- [@nilsbecker](https://github.com/nilsbecker) documented **OpenSSL upgrade issue** affecting downstream packages like Dream and slipshow ([#6736](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6736))

repositories.brief_summary: Issue triage and support activity with dependency compatibility and installation troubleshooting
repositories.activity_summary: Issue support for dependency conflicts and installation failures, plus ongoing Nix flake maintenance
repositories.activity:
- **Dependency compatibility** issue resolved quickly when [David Sancho](https://github.com/davesnx) reported yojson.3.0.0 installation conflict with ppx_yojson_conv_lib upper bound ([#1572](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1572)); [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) clarified the opam package had relaxed constraints, issue closed same day
- **Installation failure** investigation ongoing for [Alexey Vyskubov](https://github.com/avysk) experiencing ocaml-lsp-server.1.23.1 build failure on OCaml 5.3.0 with Lubuntu 25.10 ([#1571](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1571)); [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) requested full build logs to diagnose beyond compiler warnings
- **File notification bug** discussion continued on spurious unbound module errors after editing files, with [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) noting original report occurred on macOS and seeking system-specific reproduction ([#1209](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1209))
- **Nix flake updates** PR remains open with automated dependency updates including merlin5_3 and nixpkgs versions ([#1437](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/pull/1437))
repositories.contributors_summary: Support and triage provided by Ulysse, with issue reports from David Sancho and Alexey Vyskubov, plus debugging input from Rudi Grinberg
repositories.contributors:
- [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) provided issue triage and support responses for both dependency compatibility questions ([#1572](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1572)) and installation troubleshooting ([#1571](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1571))
- [David Sancho](https://github.com/davesnx) reported yojson.3.0.0 compatibility concern which was quickly resolved through clarification of opam package constraints ([#1572](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1572))
- [Alexey Vyskubov](https://github.com/avysk) reported installation failure on OCaml 5.3.0 and provided initial error logs for investigation ([#1571](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1571))
- [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) contributed debugging context about platform-specific behavior for file notification issue ([#1209](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1209))

repositories.brief_summary: Test suite improvements and issue triage with one PR merged addressing non-exhaustive pattern matching warnings
repositories.new_features_summary: Added test case ensuring non-exhaustive lambda-pattern warnings are correctly reported
repositories.new_features: - Test case added to validate **non-exhaustive pattern matching warnings** for GADT patterns with lambda functions, ensuring the bug reported in [#1517](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1517) remains fixed ([#1995](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1995))
repositories.activity_summary: Three new PRs opened for test improvements and dependency updates, with ongoing test expansion and issue triage
repositories.activity:
- Three **new PRs opened** this week including short-path test expansion by [Xavier Van de Woestyne](https://github.com/xvw) ([#1994](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1994)), GADT pattern matching test by [Tim ats](https://github.com/Tim-ats-d) ([#1996](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1996)), and Nix action dependency update from [Dependabot](https://github.com/dependabot) ([#1992](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1992))
- Merged PR adds **regression test** ensuring non-exhaustive pattern matching warnings work correctly for GADT lambda patterns by [Tim ats](https://github.com/Tim-ats-d) ([#1995](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1995)), closing long-standing issue from 2022 ([#1517](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1517))
- **Installation issue** reported by [Grégoire Jadi](https://github.com/daimrod) for Merlin 4.7-413 on Ubuntu 25.04 with OCaml 4.13.1, currently under investigation by [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) ([#1993](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1993))
repositories.discussions_summary: Code review discussions around test organization and short-path testing approach
repositories.notable_discussions:
- [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) provided feedback on [Xavier Van de Woestyne](https://github.com/xvw)'s short-path test PR, questioning the need for duplicate test source files and suggesting use of `-short-paths` command-line argument instead of `.merlin` file configuration ([#1994](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1994))
- Discussion around **test organization** and efficiency, with suggestions to streamline the test suite structure and avoid unnecessary file duplication ([#1994](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1994))
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on test suite expansion and verification that historical bugs remain fixed
repositories.emerging_trends:
- Systematic effort to **close old bug reports** by adding regression tests that verify issues are no longer reproducible, as seen with [#1517](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1517) from 2022 ([#1995](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1995), [#1996](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1996))
- Expansion of **short-path testing coverage** to ensure type path shortening works correctly across various scenarios ([#1994](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1994))
- Continued **automated dependency management** through Dependabot for GitHub Actions infrastructure ([#1992](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1992))
repositories.contributors_summary: Tim ats contributed two test-focused PRs, Xavier Van de Woestyne expanded short-path tests, and Ulysse provided code reviews
repositories.contributors:
- [Tim ats](https://github.com/Tim-ats-d) contributed two PRs adding regression tests for historical issues: merged test for non-exhaustive pattern matching ([#1995](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1995)) and opened test for GADT type constraints ([#1996](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1996))
- [Xavier Van de Woestyne](https://github.com/xvw) opened PR with batch of short-path tests covering various type shortening scenarios ([#1994](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1994))

repositories.brief_summary: Package management maturation with portable lockdirs and autolocking enabled by default, plus Coq/Rocq improvements
repositories.new_features_summary: Portable lockdirs, autolocking, unused libraries detection, dune describe tests, artifact variables, CoqProject generation
repositories.new_features:
- **Portable lockdirs enabled by default** by [Stephen Sherratt](https://github.com/gridbugs), making lock directories work across different platforms and detecting whether a lockdir is portable ([#12680](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12680))
- **Autolocking feature** by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter), allowing building package dependencies without running `dune pkg lock` first when `(pkg enabled)` is in dune-workspace ([#12653](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12653))
- **Unused libraries detection** via new `@unused-libs` alias by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) to detect unused library dependencies ([#12623](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12623))
- **New `dune describe tests` command** by [Leitao -- Pereira Dias Rodrigue](https://github.com/Gromototo) providing comprehensive test metadata ([#12545](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12545))
- **Artifact variables `%{cmt:...}` and `%{cmti:...}`** by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) for referencing compiled annotation files with typed AST ([#12634](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12634))
- **PPX pform `%{ppx:lib1+..+libn}`** by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) for referring to ppx executables in tests ([#12711](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12711))
- **Package build progress enabled by default** by [Puneeth Chaganti](https://github.com/punchagan), now respecting display settings ([#12695](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12695))
- **CoqProject file generation** by [Rodolphe Lepigre](https://github.com/rlepigre) with opt-in `(generate_project_file)` in coq.theory stanza for better editor support ([#11752](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11752))
- **Coqdoc header and footer customization** by [Rodolphe Lepigre](https://github.com/rlepigre) with new `coqdoc_header` and `coqdoc_footer` fields ([#11131](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11131))
- **Multiple modules in modules_flags for Coq** by [Rodolphe Lepigre](https://github.com/rlepigre), fixing bug that only allowed single module ([#12733](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12733))
- **Better git error messages** by [Puneeth Chaganti](https://github.com/punchagan) showing git output when Rev_store fetch fails ([#12673](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12673))
- **Non-platform-specific solver variables in portable lockdirs** by [Stephen Sherratt](https://github.com/gridbugs), fixing issue where variables like `with-doc` were incorrectly omitted ([#12678](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12678))
- **Cram test location tracking** by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) for better error messages, including conflict markers ([#12335](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12335), [#12720](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12720))
- **ocaml-index as dev tool** by [Sudha Parimala](https://github.com/Sudha247) ensuring ocaml-index is available for `@ocaml-index` alias ([#12706](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12706))
- **Documentation improvements** including opam file templates ([#12710](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12710)), Coq support ([#11752](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11752)), and artifact variables ([#12634](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12634))
repositories.activity_summary: Ongoing work on RPC fixes, package management refinements, and performance investigations including a reported 3-order magnitude regression
repositories.activity:
- **Package management refinements** including fix for lock directory assumptions ([#12712](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12712) by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter)), solver environment consistency for autolock ([#12719](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12719) by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter)), opam version reporting ([#12721](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12721) by [Stephen Sherratt](https://github.com/gridbugs)), SSH URL support ([#12701](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12701) by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter)), and chrome tracing stat events ([#12724](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12724) by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter))
- **RPC and watch mode fixes** by [Ambre Austen Suhamy](https://github.com/ElectreAAS) addressing promotion handling issues ([#12604](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12604) fixing [#12578](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12578) and [#12577](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12577)), eager watch mode promotion registration ([#12726](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12726) reproducing [#12725](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12725)), and non-deterministic hanging ([#12715](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12715))
- **Documentation and tooling** with alias documentation PR ([#12729](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12729) by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter)), cmdliner improvements ([#12728](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12728) by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter)), cram test setup scripts ([#12650](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12650) by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg)), and Emacs integration ([#12696](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12696))
- **Testing infrastructure** including new `dune runtest` functionality for tests stanzas ([#12689](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12689) by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter)), promotion improvements ([#12669](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12669), [#12615](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12615)), timeout locations ([#12657](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12657)), and build lock warning ([#12687](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12687))
- **Coq/Rocq testing** with Rocq 9.1.0 CI tests in progress ([#12734](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12734) by [Rodolphe Lepigre](https://github.com/rlepigre))
- **Bug fixes and refinements** including better unzip error messages ([#12683](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12683) by [Sudha Parimala](https://github.com/Sudha247)), dev-tool lock directory organization ([#12671](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12671)), and cache location standardization ([#11612](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11612))
repositories.discussions_summary: Controversial concurrent builds proposal and portable lockdirs UX discussions
repositories.notable_discussions:
- **Concurrent builds proposal** ([#12731](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12731)) by [Joel Reymont](https://github.com/joelreymont) proposing removal of global build lock with claims of 2-5x faster IDE and 50% faster CI, generating debate about AI-assisted development and requiring team discussion with reference implementation in [#12730](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12730)
- **Portable lockdirs UX** ([#11868](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11868)) with extensive discussion by [Stephen Sherratt](https://github.com/gridbugs) and community about platform targeting strategies and proposal refinements
- **dune pkg outdated semantics** ([#12732](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12732)) by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) debating whether the command should solve and compare versus current simpler implementation
- **Performance regression** ([#12693](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12693)) reported by [Shon Feder](https://github.com/shonfeder) showing 3 orders of magnitude slowdown in no-op builds with pkg (13s vs 850ms), requiring investigation
repositories.trends_summary: Package management maturation, Coq/Rocq ecosystem investment, performance focus, and testing infrastructure improvements
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Package management reaching production readiness** with portable lockdirs ([#12680](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12680)) and autolocking ([#12653](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12653)) enabled by default, moving dune pkg toward stable release
- **Coq/Rocq ecosystem support expansion** through CoqProject generation ([#11752](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11752)), coqdoc customization ([#11131](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11131)), bug fixes ([#12733](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12733)), and Rocq 9.1.0 testing ([#12734](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12734))
- **Performance optimization focus** with regression investigation ([#12693](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12693)), chrome tracing improvements ([#12724](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12724)), and concurrent builds proposal ([#12731](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12731))
- **Developer experience improvements** including better error messages ([#12673](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12673), [#12683](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12683)), location tracking ([#12335](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12335), [#12720](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12720)), unused library warnings ([#12623](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12623)), and test introspection ([#12545](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12545))
- **Testing infrastructure investment** with cram test improvements ([#12335](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12335), [#12720](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12720), [#12657](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12657)), new test commands ([#12545](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12545), [#12689](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12689)), and ppx testing tools ([#12711](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12711))
- **Long-standing issue resolution** with closure of 2018 issue about unused library warnings ([#650](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/650)) via [#12623](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12623)

repositories.brief_summary: Planning underway for parameterized libraries support in odoc documentation
repositories.activity_summary: Issue opened to track support for representing parameterized libraries in documentation
repositories.activity: - **Parameterized libraries support** planned for odoc by [Shon Feder](https://github.com/shonfeder) following Dune's extension to support parametric libraries via the oxcaml compiler ([#1390](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1390)). While odoc currently builds documentation for projects using this feature without errors, it does not render library parameters or parametric libraries with any distinction. Work is planned with [@art-w](https://github.com/art-w) taking the lead on implementation, based on evaluation documented in [ocaml/dune#12565](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12565).
repositories.contributors_summary: Shon Feder opened planning issue for parameterized libraries documentation support
repositories.contributors: - [Shon Feder](https://github.com/shonfeder) opened [#1390](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1390) to track the planned work for adding support to represent parameterized libraries in odoc, coordinating with [@art-w](https://github.com/art-w) for implementation.

repositories.discussions_summary: Android/Termux custom compiler support discussion revealing ocaml-system package limitations and platform compatibility challenges
repositories.notable_discussions:
- **Android/Termux OCaml support** discussion in [#28871](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28871) where [@lost22git](https://github.com/lost22git) sought help installing packages with a custom OCaml 5.5.0+dev compiler built from source, [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) provided guidance on using ocaml-system package via temporary repository ([#28455](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28455)) but revealed platform limitations including lwt Android incompatibility and ocamlformat lacking OCaml trunk support
- **MSYS2/Cygwin toolchain compatibility** discussion in [#28851](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28851) for Unison where [Jacques-Henri Jourdan](https://github.com/jhjourdan) and [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) clarified that Cairo/lablgtk issues affect MSVC only, not MSYS2, leading to proper constraint recommendations
- **x-maintenance-intent** field requests appearing across multiple PRs as repository maintainers encourage adoption of archiving policy ([governance documentation](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/blob/master/governance/policies/archiving.md))
repositories.trends_summary: Beta testing cycle for ecosystem tools, WebAssembly investment, cross-platform expansion, and quality-focused maintenance practices
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Beta release coordination** across infrastructure with OPAM 2.5.0~beta1, Lwt 6.0.0-beta01, and Frama-C 32.0~beta entering testing phase simultaneously, indicating ecosystem-wide preparation for updates
- **WebAssembly ecosystem expansion** demonstrated by 9 binaryen package releases from [Oscar Spencer](https://github.com/ospencer) tracking upstream versions 122-124, reflecting OCaml's growing WebAssembly capabilities
- **Cross-platform reach** extending through Android/Termux support discussions ([#28871](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28871)), MSYS2/Cygwin CI improvements ([#28856](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28856), [#28897](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28897)), 32-bit architecture support (fit 1.4.0 [#28904](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28904)), and OCaml/Unikraft 1.1.0 unikernel support ([#28750](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28750))
- **Quality improvements** in CI infrastructure catching LLVM 19 compatibility issues early (conf-libclang failures in [#28843](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28843)), URL migration preventing curl failures ([#28896](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28896)), and systematic constraint corrections ([#28805](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28805))
- **Documentation standardization** with recurring x-maintenance-intent field requests across [#28847](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28847), [#28879](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28879), [#28893](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28893), and others, aligning with repository archiving governance
- **Data format diversity** shown through new JSON Feed ([#28884](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28884)), Apache Avro ([#28910](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28910)), Protocol Buffers ([#28902](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28902)), and Crockford Base32 ([#28885](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28885)) implementations
- **Web development tooling** advancement through Melange 6.0.0 ([#28866](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28866)), ojs_base 0.9.0 suite ([#28882](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28882)), and static site generation tools (raga [#28847](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28847), handlebars-ml [#28846](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28846))
- **Specialized domain coverage** expanding from quantum computing (qcaml [#28840](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28840)) to legal programming (Catala 1.0.0 [#28853](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28853)) to fitness data (fit [#28904](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28904))

repositories.brief_summary: Browser target bug fix merged, ongoing WebAssembly development continues
repositories.new_features_summary: Runtime now properly handles browser target without requiring Node.js modules
repositories.new_features:
- Fixed **runtime behavior** for `target-env=browser` to eliminate erroneous `require("node:util")` and similar Node.js imports in browser-targeted builds, with new browser-specific implementations for `caml_sys_temp_dir_name` and `caml_strerror` functions ([#2129](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2129))
- Added **test coverage** to verify browser-targeted builds no longer include Node.js-specific require calls ([46958641d0a8e98c6ee86cf1e767236a51a3d61c](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/46958641d0a8e98c6ee86cf1e767236a51a3d61c))
repositories.activity_summary: WebAssembly eval function and benchmark PRs remain in development
repositories.activity:
- [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon)'s **WebAssembly runtime** PR providing access to JavaScript eval function continues in review with pending comments from [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) before merge ([#2108](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2108))
- **Performance benchmarking** work comparing Js_of_ocaml and Wasm_of_ocaml remains in draft status with merge conflicts affecting 326 files ([#2099](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2099))
repositories.discussions_summary: WebAssembly export capabilities and runtime compatibility being explored
repositories.notable_discussions:
- [NSlash951](https://github.com/myfreess) inquired about **exporting specific OCaml functions** in WebAssembly output from wasm_of_ocaml, with [@ec-c](https://github.com/ec-c) expressing interest in this currently unsupported feature ([#2028](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2028))
- [@nickbetteridge](https://github.com/nickbetteridge) reported switching from **wamr to wasmtime** runtime due to type mismatch issues, noting they're waiting for the WASI runtime PR ([#1831](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1831)) to be merged before releasing their wit library work ([#1929](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1929))
repositories.contributors_summary: Two contributors active with bug fix implementation and ongoing PR reviews
repositories.contributors:
- [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) fixed the browser target runtime issue by implementing browser-specific versions of system functions, added comprehensive test coverage to detect Node.js require calls in browser builds, and provided review feedback on the WebAssembly eval function PR ([#2129](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2129), [#2108](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2108))
- [Rizo](https://github.com/rizo) reported the browser target bug that was preventing upgrades to the latest version and confirmed the fix resolved their issue ([#2127](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2127))
- [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) continues work on the WebAssembly runtime eval function PR awaiting final review comments ([#2108](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2108))
- [NSlash951](https://github.com/myfreess) and [@ec-c](https://github.com/ec-c) participated in discussion about WebAssembly function export capabilities ([#2028](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2028))
- [@nickbetteridge](https://github.com/nickbetteridge) provided updates on WebAssembly runtime compatibility challenges and workarounds ([#1929](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1929))

repositories.brief_summary: Modes system enhancements, SIMD intrinsics expansion, slambda IR introduction, and metaprogramming improvements
repositories.new_features_summary: Added shareable mode, -dslambda flag, slambda IR with static evaluation, SIMD load/store intrinsics, and .cms file installation
repositories.new_features:
- **Shareable mode** added to portability axis, distinguishing functions that capture shared state and can execute in parallel from portable (contended) and nonportable (uncontended) functions ([#4982](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4982))
- **Slambda intermediate representation** introduced as new compilation phase between lambda and static evaluation, with `-dslambda` flag for debugging ([#4776](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4776))
- **SIMD load/store intrinsics** for all SSE and AVX operations using memory operands, including specialized handling for maskmovdqu with implicit RDI addressing ([#4994](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4994), [#4988](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4988))
- **Global implies aliased** constraint enforced syntactically, preventing unsound `@@ global unique` combinations for future borrowing implementation ([#4889](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4889))
- **Mode hints for containing** relationships added between containers (tuples, records, arrays) and their elements, improving error messages ([#4919](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4919))
- **Share context moved to mode hints** through new `Is_used_in` hint and `Const_closure_lock`, replacing previous share_context mechanism ([#4983](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4983))
- **Mod bound parsing refactored** to reuse modality logic with canonical axis ordering in output ([#4931](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4931))
- **Camlinternaleval shared JIT** allowing mdx to reuse bindings across fragments without bundle mechanism ([#4900](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4900), [#4909](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4909), [#4899](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4899))
- **Exception declaration location fixes** preventing dummy error locations in derived code ([#4993](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4993), [#4996](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4996))
- **Coerced application tail position** fix ensuring type_argument correctly marks non-tail expressions ([#4999](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4999))
- **Mixed block approximations** handling in classic mode to prevent assertions when importing non-value types ([#4989](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4989))
- **SIMD sign extension removal** for int8/int16 vector casts as frontend now handles sign-extension automatically ([#4987](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4987))
- **Probes support removal** for deprecated Closure middle end ([#4990](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4990))
- **Installation of .cms files** alongside .cmt files for debug information and Merlin integration, adding 352 files (~4 MB) ([#5005](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5005))
- **Scannable axes parsing** infrastructure with `non_pointer` and `maybe_pointer` annotations (warnings disabled by default) ([#4992](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4992))
repositories.activity_summary: Twenty-seven new PRs opened covering pointerness axes, jkind normalization, probes, metaprogramming, and GC optimizations
repositories.activity:
- **New PRs opened** include downstream of [ocaml/ocaml#13866](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13866) for `occur_rec` optimization by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) ([#5015](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5015)), unboxed module elements allowing non-value fields by [James Rayman](https://github.com/jra4) ([#4020](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4020)), `Tof_jkind` for unboxed existentials by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) ([#4995](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4995)), pointerness as scannable axis by [Zack Eisbach](https://github.com/zackbach) ([#5006](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5006)), runtime metaprogramming extension by [Andrej Ivašković](https://github.com/Dreian) ([#5012](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5012)), and fuel increase to 10 with linear normalization by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) ([#5009](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5009))
- **Backend and infrastructure work** progressing with `.cmxs` format changes for import headers by [Simon Spies](https://github.com/spiessimon) ([#5014](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5014)), debug info ordering fix between `Name_for_debugger` and stack spilling ([#5013](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5013)), unoptimized probes implementation by [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) ([#4991](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4991)) and [Greta Yorsh](https://github.com/gretay-js) ([#5007](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5007)), probes refactoring ([#5011](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5011)), compile-time arch constants ([#4972](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4972)), and x86 peephole optimization for dead register moves by [Xavier Clerc](https://github.com/xclerc) ([#4985](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4985))
- **Metrics and CI improvements** delivered through per-artifact size tracking instead of aggregation by [Xavier Clerc](https://github.com/xclerc) ([#5003](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5003)), profile collection alongside artifact sizes ([#5004](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5004)), CFG instruction equality functions ([#5002](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5002)), and `-dump-dir` race condition fix ([#5010](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5010))
- **Type system and modes development** advancing with metaprogramming review by [Jack Rickard](https://github.com/Skepfyr) ([#4981](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4981)), arrays of GC-ignorable values by [@dkalinichenko-js](https://github.com/dkalinichenko-js) ([#4963](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4963)), crossing parsing support by [Zack Eisbach](https://github.com/zackbach) ([#4781](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4781)), limited `mod contended` inference ([#4929](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4929)), and `Typeopt.value_kind` level preservation ([#4549](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4549))
- **Debugging infrastructure work** including LLDB OxCaml language plugin by [Simon Spies](https://github.com/spiessimon) ([#4961](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4961)), function sections with DWARF support ([#4934](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4934)), and reversible name mangling scheme by [Tim McGilchrist](https://github.com/tmcgilchrist) ([#4850](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4850))
- **Runtime and GC optimization** explored through effect primitives refactoring removing `Must_not_enter_gc` by [Aspen Smith](https://github.com/glittershark) ([#4901](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4901)), preemption implementation ([#4881](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4881)), and major GC marking loop optimization by [Nick Barnes](https://github.com/NickBarnes) ([#4997](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4997))
- **Miscellaneous improvements** including manifest files support by [Andrei Odintsov](https://github.com/Forestryks) ([#4986](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4986)), dune version documentation update by [Sadiq Jaffer](https://github.com/sadiqj) ([#5000](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5000)), and Ccatch simplification for boolean computation by [Xavier Clerc](https://github.com/xclerc) ([#4998](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4998))
repositories.discussions_summary: Upstream collaboration on occur_rec optimization with discussion on performance impact and benchmark plans
repositories.notable_discussions:
- **Upstream downstreaming coordination** for [ocaml/ocaml#13866](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13866) involving [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) who provided the upstream fix that [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) is downstreaming, with [Richard Eisenberg](https://github.com/goldfirere) planning performance benchmarks ([#5015](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5015))
- **Mixed module implementation review** for top-level unboxed elements with detailed discussions on module representations, coercions, parameterized libraries, and toplevel limitations between [James Rayman](https://github.com/jra4), [Vincent Laviron](https://github.com/lthls), [Chris Casinghino](https://github.com/ccasin), and [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) ([#4020](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4020))
- **Jkind normalization approach** discussion between [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) and [Richard Eisenberg](https://github.com/goldfirere) on using `Tof_jkind` versus tracking existentials, with questions about `fixed` parameter usage and type levels ([#4995](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4995))
- **GC-ignorable arrays semantics** clarification between [@dkalinichenko-js](https://github.com/dkalinichenko-js) and [Vincent Laviron](https://github.com/lthls) regarding `caml_modify` skipping and scanner behavior for external values ([#4963](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4963))
- **Scannable axes design decisions** between [Zack Eisbach](https://github.com/zackbach) and [Ryan Tjoa](https://github.com/rtjoa) covering warning messages, parsetree structure, CR conventions, and terminology choices for kind modifiers ([#4992](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4992))
repositories.trends_summary: Intensifying focus on modes system refinement, SIMD intrinsics completion, metaprogramming infrastructure, and performance optimization
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Modes system maturation** evident through shareable mode addition, mode hints refactoring, crossing infrastructure, and global-aliased constraints representing systematic expansion of the modes type system
- **SIMD intrinsics buildout** continuing with load/store operations, memory operand generalization, and addressing mode support showing commitment to complete SIMD instruction coverage
- **Metaprogramming infrastructure** development through slambda IR, Camlinternaleval improvements, translquote review, and runtime metaprogramming extension indicating preparation for staged compilation
- **Type system sophistication** advancing with pointerness axes, jkind normalization fuel increases, unboxed module elements, and GC-ignorable arrays extending layout expressiveness
- **Debugging tooling investment** through .cms file installation, DWARF improvements, name mangling, and LLDB plugin demonstrating focus on developer experience
- **Performance optimization efforts** spanning GC marking loops, peephole optimizations, and profile collection infrastructure showing attention to runtime efficiency
- **Upstream coordination** visible through occur_rec downstreaming and collaboration with [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) maintaining connection with upstream OCaml development
repositories.contributors_summary: Sixteen contributors active with work spanning modes, SIMD, metaprogramming, type system, debugging, and runtime optimization
repositories.contributors:
- [@liam923](https://github.com/liam923) downstreamed [ocaml/ocaml#13866](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13866) for `occur_rec` optimization ([#5015](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5015)), implemented `Tof_jkind` for unboxed existentials and Tpolys ([#4995](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4995)), and increased jkind normalization fuel to 10 with linear caching ([#5009](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5009))
- [@TheNumbat](https://github.com/TheNumbat) implemented SIMD load/store intrinsics ([#4994](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4994)), generalized SIMD memory operands ([#4988](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4988)), added shareable mode ([#4982](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4982)), and removed SIMD sign extension ([#4987](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4987))
- [@spiessimon](https://github.com/spiessimon) installed .cms files alongside .cmt files ([#5005](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5005)), worked on .cmxs format changes ([#5014](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5014)), fixed debug info ordering ([#5013](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5013)), developed LLDB language plugin ([#4961](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4961)), enabled function sections with DWARF ([#4934](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4934)), and reviewed various backend PRs
- [@xclerc](https://github.com/xclerc) refactored metrics for per-artifact tracking ([#5003](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5003)) and profile collection ([#5004](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5004)), added CFG equality functions ([#5002](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5002)), fixed dump-dir race condition ([#5010](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5010)), implemented x86 peephole optimization ([#4985](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4985)), and explored Ccatch boolean simplification ([#4998](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4998))
- [@zackbach](https://github.com/zackbach) added pointerness as scannable axis ([#5006](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5006)), implemented scannable axes parsing ([#4992](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4992)), developed crossing parsing support ([#4781](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4781)), and worked on limited mod contended inference ([#4929](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4929))
- [@dkalinichenko-js](https://github.com/dkalinichenko-js) implemented arrays of GC-ignorable values ([#4963](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4963)), refactored mod bound parsing ([#4931](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4931)), enforced global implies aliased ([#4889](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4889)), preserved levels in Typeopt.value_kind ([#4549](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4549)), and reviewed modes-related PRs
- [@gretay-js](https://github.com/gretay-js) developed unoptimized probes implementation ([#5007](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5007)), refactored probes code generation ([#5011](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5011)), added compile-time arch constants ([#4972](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4972)), and reviewed SIMD PRs
- [@mshinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) removed probes support for old Closure ([#4990](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4990)), implemented unoptimized probes ([#4991](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4991)), fixed Camlinternaleval for mdx ([#4900](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4900)), handled No_such_module in Cm_bundle ([#4909](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4909)), and fixed camlinternaleval link order ([#4899](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4899))
- [@riaqn](https://github.com/riaqn) moved share_context to mode hints ([#4983](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4983)), fixed exception declaration attributes location ([#4996](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4996)), and added mode hints for containing ([#4919](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4919))
- [@lukemaurer](https://github.com/lukemaurer) introduced slambda IR with trivial translation and evaluation ([#4776](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4776))
- [@lthls](https://github.com/lthls) fixed mixed block approximation import in classic mode ([#4989](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4989)) and provided detailed reviews on mixed modules PR ([#4020](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4020))
- [@Skepfyr](https://github.com/Skepfyr) marked coerced applications as nontail ([#4999](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4999)) and reviewed translquote implementation ([#4981](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4981))
- [@mdelvecchio-jsc](https://github.com/mdelvecchio-jsc) fixed exception declaration location ([#4993](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4993))
- [@jra4](https://github.com/jra4) developed unboxed module elements support ([#4020](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4020))
- [@NickBarnes](https://github.com/NickBarnes) optimized GC marking loop by eliminating global accesses ([#4997](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4997))
- [@Dreian](https://github.com/Dreian) added runtime metaprogramming extension ([#5012](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5012)) and reviewed translquote ([#4981](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4981))
- [@glittershark](https://github.com/glittershark) refactored effect primitives ([#4901](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4901)) and worked on preemption ([#4881](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4881))
- [@tmcgilchrist](https://github.com/tmcgilchrist) developed reversible name mangling scheme ([#4850](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4850))
- [@Forestryks](https://github.com/Forestryks) added manifest files support ([#4986](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4986))
- [@sadiqj](https://github.com/sadiqj) updated dune version in README ([#5000](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5000))
- [@Octachron](https://github.com/Octachron) provided upstream occur_rec optimization that was downstreamed ([#5015](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5015))
- [@goldfirere](https://github.com/goldfirere), [@ccasin](https://github.com/ccasin), and [@rtjoa](https://github.com/rtjoa) provided reviews across multiple PRs

repositories.brief_summary: Bug fixes for parameterized libraries, syntax doc ghost locations, and AFL instrumentation flags
repositories.new_features_summary: AFL instrumentation flags support, ghost location filtering in syntax docs, parameterized library crash prevention
repositories.new_features:
- Added support for **AFL instrumentation flags** `-afl-instrument` and `-afl-inst-ratio` to the list of ignored compiler flags, enabling fuzzing workflows without Merlin interference ([#198](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/pull/198))
- Fixed spurious **syntax documentation hints** for `[@nontail]` attributes by filtering out ghost locations from syntax doc analysis, preventing display of hints for PPX-generated ghost nodes ([#197](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/pull/197))
- Implemented **crash prevention** in short path analysis when working with parameterized libraries by properly handling module name types and dependency tracking ([#196](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/pull/196))
repositories.activity_summary: Three PRs merged addressing compiler flag compatibility, syntax documentation accuracy, and type system stability
repositories.activity:
- **Parameterized library support** improved by [Zesen Qian](https://github.com/riaqn) with conservative fixes to prevent crashes in short path analysis when handling parameterized modules, addressing issues in persistent environment and short paths graph handling ([#196](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/pull/196))
- **Syntax documentation filtering** enhanced by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) to exclude ghost locations from syntax doc hints, resolving reports of spurious `[@nontail]` attribute documentation appearing due to PPX-generated ghost nodes ([#197](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/pull/197))
- **AFL fuzzing support** added by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) through recognition of AFL instrumentation compiler flags, with review feedback from [Aaron Bauer](https://github.com/awilliambauer) fixing semicolon placement ([#198](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/pull/198))
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on improving stability and compatibility with advanced OCaml features and tooling ecosystem
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Advanced type system features** receiving attention with fixes for parameterized libraries and module system edge cases, indicating ongoing work to support newer OCaml language features ([#196](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/pull/196))
- **PPX ecosystem compatibility** improvements through better handling of ghost locations and compiler-generated attributes in IDE tooling ([#197](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/pull/197))
- **Fuzzing and testing infrastructure** integration with AFL instrumentation support showing commitment to quality assurance workflows ([#198](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/pull/198))
repositories.contributors_summary: Contributions from Liam Stevenson, Zesen Qian with reviews from Leo White and Aaron Bauer
repositories.contributors:
- [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) implemented syntax documentation improvements filtering ghost locations ([#197](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/pull/197)) and added AFL instrumentation flag support ([#198](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/pull/198))
- [Zesen Qian](https://github.com/riaqn) developed the conservative fix for parameterized libraries in short path analysis, preventing crashes when handling module dependencies ([#196](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/pull/196))
- [Leo White](https://github.com/lpw25) provided code review guidance on the parameterized libraries fix, suggesting changes from `find_opt` to `find` and collaborating on the implementation approach ([#196](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/pull/196))
- [Aaron Bauer](https://github.com/awilliambauer) reviewed the AFL flags implementation and identified a semicolon placement issue that needed correction ([#198](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/pull/198))

repositories.brief_summary: New API proposal for updating Eio environments with modified capabilities
repositories.activity_summary: Proposal to add environment update function supporting capability-based programming patterns
repositories.activity: - [Patrick Ferris](https://github.com/patricoferris) opened [#823](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/pull/823) proposing `Eio_unix.Stdenv.with_env` function to enable updating environments with modified capabilities, addressing ergonomic needs when using **subtyped environment patterns** where programs define custom environment types extending `Eio_unix.Stdenv.t` and need to swap out individual capabilities like process managers for debugging or testing purposes
repositories.discussions_summary: Discussion about returning to object-based API design for improved ergonomics
repositories.notable_discussions: - [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) commented on [#823](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/pull/823) expressing interest in reconsidering **object-based APIs** for Eio resources, suggesting that object ergonomics may be superior to the current `Eio.Resource.T` API approach
repositories.contributors_summary: Patrick Ferris proposed new environment API, Anil Madhavapeddy participated in design discussion
repositories.contributors:
- [Patrick Ferris](https://github.com/patricoferris) opened [#823](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/pull/823) proposing the `Eio_unix.Stdenv.with_env` function with implementation and detailed use case explanation from his work on the Shelter project
- [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) provided feedback on [#823](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/pull/823) regarding API design considerations

group_summaries.brief_summary: OPAM 2.5.0~beta1 released with 43 packages merged including Catala 1.0.0, WebAssembly tooling, and cross-platform improvements
group_summaries.new_features_summary: OPAM 2.5.0~beta1, Catala 1.0.0, raga static site generator, WebAssembly tooling updates, and cross-platform improvements
