- **Unison 2.53.8** file synchronization tool opened with separate TUI/GUI builds and native macOS GUI support, undergoing build process improvements ([ocaml/opam-repository#28851](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28851))
- **frama-clang 0.0.19~beta** opened but blocked by conf-libclang compatibility issues with LLVM 19 ([ocaml/opam-repository#28843](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28843))
- **css 0.4.0** CSS parser/printer opened but requires fixes for compilation errors ([ocaml/opam-repository#28870](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28870))
- **reason 3.17.1** syntax and toolchain update with 2 packages opened by [Antonio Nuno Monteiro](https://github.com/anmonteiro) ([ocaml/opam-repository#28867](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28867))
- **Windows CI improvements** for MSYS2/Cygwin platforms merged including ocamlfind.1.9.8 constraint for OCaml < 5.0.0 by [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) and x-ci-accept-failures teaching ([ocaml/opam-repository#28897](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28897), [ocaml/opam-repository#28856](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28856))
- **Repository maintenance** including alt-ergo URL migration from HTTP to HTTPS affecting 20 files to prevent curl failures by [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid), correction of `os != "windows"` constraints, and solo5 duplicate x-ci-accept-failures fix ([ocaml/opam-repository#28896](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28896), [ocaml/opam-repository#28805](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28805), [ocaml/opam-repository#28865](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28865))
- **Metadata updates** for 57 package files opened ([ocaml/opam-repository#28908](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28908))
- **odoc-driver** upper bound fix merged following OPAM 2.5.0~beta1 revdep failure by [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) ([ocaml/opam-repository#28890](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28890))
- **hilite** depopts added for cmarkit ([ocaml/opam-repository#28857](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28857))
- **saltoIL 0.2.0** when clause support merged ([ocaml/opam-repository#28834](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28834))
- **alice 0.1.0** new package merged by [Stephen Sherratt](https://github.com/gridbugs) ([ocaml/opam-repository#28863](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28863))
- **acgtk 2.2.0** and **bogue.20250224** GUI library updates merged ([ocaml/opam-repository#28858](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28858), [ocaml/opam-repository#27497](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27497))
group_summaries.group_overview:
- The ecosystem group coordinated the **OPAM 2.5.0~beta1 release** across [ocaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository) ([ocaml/opam-repository#28877](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28877)) and [ocaml/ocaml.org](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org) ([ocaml/ocaml.org#3395](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/pull/3395)), with [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) releasing 8 core packages and documenting the release on the website
- **43 packages merged** in [ocaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository) spanning infrastructure tools, WebAssembly tooling, data format libraries, web development frameworks, and specialized domain applications
- **Cross-platform improvements** delivered through MSYS2/Cygwin CI fixes ([ocaml/opam-repository#28897](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28897), [ocaml/opam-repository#28856](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28856)), OCaml/Unikraft 1.1.0 unikernel support ([ocaml/opam-repository#28750](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28750)), and Android/Termux support discussions ([ocaml/opam-repository#28871](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28871))
- **Beta testing cycle** underway with OPAM 2.5.0~beta1, Lwt 6.0.0-beta01 ([ocaml/opam-repository#28894](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28894)), and Frama-C 32.0~beta ([ocaml/opam-repository#28842](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28842)) entering simultaneous testing
- **Repository maintenance** focused on infrastructure quality with URL migrations ([ocaml/opam-repository#28896](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28896)), constraint corrections ([ocaml/opam-repository#28805](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28805)), and x-maintenance-intent field adoption across multiple PRs
group_summaries.cross_repository_work:
- **OPAM 2.5.0~beta1 release coordination** between [ocaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository) and [ocaml/ocaml.org](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org) by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate), releasing 8 packages ([ocaml/opam-repository#28877](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28877)) and documenting the release with a changelog PR ([ocaml/ocaml.org#3395](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/pull/3395))
- **Revdep testing fallout** from OPAM 2.5.0~beta1 requiring odoc-driver upper bound fix by [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) ([ocaml/opam-repository#28890](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28890))
group_summaries.notable_discussions:
- **Android/Termux OCaml support** discussion in [ocaml/opam-repository#28871](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28871) where a developer sought help installing packages with a custom OCaml 5.5.0+dev compiler built from source, [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) provided guidance on using ocaml-system package via temporary repository ([ocaml/opam-repository#28455](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28455)) but revealed platform limitations including lwt Android incompatibility and ocamlformat lacking OCaml trunk support
- **MSYS2/Cygwin toolchain compatibility** discussion in [ocaml/opam-repository#28851](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28851) for Unison where [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) clarified that Cairo/lablgtk issues affect MSVC only, not MSYS2, leading to proper constraint recommendations
- **x-maintenance-intent** field requests appearing across multiple PRs ([ocaml/opam-repository#28847](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28847), [ocaml/opam-repository#28879](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28879), [ocaml/opam-repository#28893](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28893)) as repository maintainers encourage adoption of [archiving policy](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/blob/master/governance/policies/archiving.md)
group_summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Beta release coordination** across infrastructure with OPAM 2.5.0~beta1 ([ocaml/opam-repository#28877](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28877)), Lwt 6.0.0-beta01 ([ocaml/opam-repository#28894](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28894)), and Frama-C 32.0~beta ([ocaml/opam-repository#28842](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28842)) entering testing phase simultaneously, indicating ecosystem-wide preparation for updates
- **WebAssembly ecosystem expansion** demonstrated by 9 binaryen package releases from [Oscar Spencer](https://github.com/ospencer) tracking upstream versions 122-124 ([ocaml/opam-repository#28859](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28859), [ocaml/opam-repository#28860](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28860), [ocaml/opam-repository#28861](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28861), [ocaml/opam-repository#28880](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28880), [ocaml/opam-repository#28887](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28887), [ocaml/opam-repository#28888](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28888)), reflecting OCaml's growing WebAssembly capabilities
- **Cross-platform reach** extending through Android/Termux support discussions ([ocaml/opam-repository#28871](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28871)), MSYS2/Cygwin CI improvements ([ocaml/opam-repository#28856](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28856), [ocaml/opam-repository#28897](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28897)), 32-bit architecture support (fit 1.4.0 [ocaml/opam-repository#28904](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28904)), and OCaml/Unikraft 1.1.0 unikernel support ([ocaml/opam-repository#28750](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28750))
- **Quality improvements** in CI infrastructure catching LLVM 19 compatibility issues early (conf-libclang failures in [ocaml/opam-repository#28843](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28843)), URL migration preventing curl failures ([ocaml/opam-repository#28896](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28896)), and systematic constraint corrections ([ocaml/opam-repository#28805](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28805))
- **Documentation standardization** with recurring x-maintenance-intent field requests across [ocaml/opam-repository#28847](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28847), [ocaml/opam-repository#28879](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28879), [ocaml/opam-repository#28893](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28893), and others, aligning with repository archiving governance
- **Data format diversity** shown through new JSON Feed ([ocaml/opam-repository#28884](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28884)), Apache Avro ([ocaml/opam-repository#28910](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28910)), Protocol Buffers ([ocaml/opam-repository#28902](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28902)), and Crockford Base32 ([ocaml/opam-repository#28885](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28885)) implementations
- **Web development tooling** advancement through Melange 6.0.0 ([ocaml/opam-repository#28866](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28866)), ojs_base 0.9.0 suite ([ocaml/opam-repository#28882](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28882)), and static site generation tools (raga [ocaml/opam-repository#28847](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28847), handlebars-ml [ocaml/opam-repository#28846](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28846))
- **Specialized domain coverage** expanding from quantum computing (qcaml [ocaml/opam-repository#28840](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28840)) to legal programming (Catala 1.0.0 [ocaml/opam-repository#28853](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28853)) to fitness data (fit [ocaml/opam-repository#28904](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28904))

group_summaries.brief_summary: Package management maturation in Dune and opam 2.5.0~beta1 release with significant fixes
group_summaries.new_features_summary: Portable lockdirs and autolocking in Dune, dry-run fixes and macOS sandbox improvements in opam
group_summaries.new_features:
- **Portable lockdirs enabled by default** in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) by [Stephen Sherratt](https://github.com/gridbugs), making lock directories work across different platforms ([ocaml/dune#12680](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12680))
- **Autolocking feature** in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter), allowing building package dependencies without running `dune pkg lock` first when `(pkg enabled)` is in dune-workspace ([ocaml/dune#12653](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12653))
- **Unused libraries detection** via new `@unused-libs` alias in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) to detect unused library dependencies ([ocaml/dune#12623](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12623))
- **New `dune describe tests` command** in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) by [Leitao -- Pereira Dias Rodrigue](https://github.com/Gromototo) providing comprehensive test metadata ([ocaml/dune#12545](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12545))
- **Artifact variables `%{cmt:...}` and `%{cmti:...}`** in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) for referencing compiled annotation files with typed AST ([ocaml/dune#12634](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12634))
- **PPX pform `%{ppx:lib1+..+libn}`** in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) for referring to ppx executables in tests ([ocaml/dune#12711](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12711))
- **Package build progress enabled by default** in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) by [Puneeth Chaganti](https://github.com/punchagan), now respecting display settings ([ocaml/dune#12695](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12695))
- **CoqProject file generation** in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) by [Rodolphe Lepigre](https://github.com/rlepigre) with opt-in `(generate_project_file)` in coq.theory stanza for better editor support ([ocaml/dune#11752](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11752))
- **Coqdoc header and footer customization** in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) by [Rodolphe Lepigre](https://github.com/rlepigre) with new `coqdoc_header` and `coqdoc_footer` fields ([ocaml/dune#11131](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11131))
- **Fixed `--dry-run` mode** in [ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam) for `opam switch create` which was incorrectly creating switch root directories and build artifacts ([ocaml/opam#6540](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6540))
- **Fixed macOS sandbox** in [ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam) to allow writes in `/var/folders/` and `/var/db/mds/` directories required by macOS core tools ([ocaml/opam#4797](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/4797), [ocaml/opam#4389](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/4389), [ocaml/opam#6460](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6460))
- **Fixed version-equivalent package rename bug** in [ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam) where renaming packages like `pkg.00` to `pkg.0` caused complete package removal ([ocaml/opam#6774](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6774), [ocaml/opam#6754](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6754))
- **Fixed runtime behavior** in [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml) for `target-env=browser` to eliminate erroneous `require("node:util")` and similar Node.js imports in browser-targeted builds ([ocsigen/js_of_ocaml#2129](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2129))
group_summaries.group_overview:
- [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) saw substantial activity with package management features reaching production readiness through portable lockdirs ([ocaml/dune#12680](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12680)) and autolocking ([ocaml/dune#12653](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12653)) enabled by default, plus Coq/Rocq ecosystem investment and developer experience improvements
- [ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam) released version 2.5.0~beta1 with critical fixes for dry-run mode ([ocaml/opam#6540](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6540)), macOS sandbox ([ocaml/opam#4797](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/4797)), and package rename handling ([ocaml/opam#6774](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6774))
- [ocaml/merlin](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin) focused on test suite expansion with regression tests for historical issues ([ocaml/merlin#1995](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1995), [ocaml/merlin#1996](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1996))
- [ocaml/odoc](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc) initiated planning for parameterized libraries documentation support ([ocaml/odoc#1390](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1390))
- [ocaml/ocaml-lsp](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp) handled dependency compatibility questions ([ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1572](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1572)) and installation troubleshooting ([ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1571](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1571))
- [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml) fixed browser target runtime issue preventing Node.js module imports in browser builds ([ocsigen/js_of_ocaml#2129](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2129))
- [ocaml/ocamlfind](https://github.com/ocaml/ocamlfind), [ocaml/opam-file-format](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-file-format), and [ocaml-dune/spawn](https://github.com/ocaml-dune/spawn) had no activity during this period
group_summaries.activity_summary: RPC and watch mode fixes in Dune, documentation PRs in opam, test improvements in Merlin, and WebAssembly work in js_of_ocaml
group_summaries.activity:
- **Package management refinements** in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) including lock directory assumptions fix ([ocaml/dune#12712](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12712)), solver environment consistency for autolock ([ocaml/dune#12719](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12719)), opam version reporting ([ocaml/dune#12721](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12721)), SSH URL support ([ocaml/dune#12701](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12701)), and chrome tracing stat events ([ocaml/dune#12724](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12724)) by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) and [Stephen Sherratt](https://github.com/gridbugs)
- **RPC and watch mode fixes** in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) by [Ambre Austen Suhamy](https://github.com/ElectreAAS) addressing promotion handling issues ([ocaml/dune#12604](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12604) fixing [ocaml/dune#12578](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12578) and [ocaml/dune#12577](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12577)), eager watch mode promotion registration ([ocaml/dune#12726](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12726) reproducing [ocaml/dune#12725](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12725)), and non-deterministic hanging ([ocaml/dune#12715](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12715))
- **Coq/Rocq testing** in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) with Rocq 9.1.0 CI tests in progress ([ocaml/dune#12734](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12734)) by [Rodolphe Lepigre](https://github.com/rlepigre)
- **Documentation improvements** in [ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam) by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) covering compiler selection with configure-time options ([ocaml/opam#6777](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6777)) and default compiler selection behavior ([ocaml/opam#6778](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6778)), both awaiting updates based on review feedback from [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27)
- **Performance optimization research** in [ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam) continuing with repository structure redesign to use tar.gz archives directly ([ocaml/opam#6625](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6625), [ocaml/opam#5741](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/5741)), depext status checking at update time ([ocaml/opam#6489](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6489)), and benchmark expansion ([ocaml/opam#6567](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6567))
- **Test suite expansion** in [ocaml/merlin](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin) with short-path test expansion ([ocaml/merlin#1994](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1994)) by [Xavier Van de Woestyne](https://github.com/xvw) and GADT pattern matching test ([ocaml/merlin#1996](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1996)) by [Tim ats](https://github.com/Tim-ats-d)
- **WebAssembly runtime** in [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml) PR providing access to JavaScript eval function continues in review ([ocsigen/js_of_ocaml#2108](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2108)) by [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon)
- **Installation troubleshooting** in [ocaml/ocaml-lsp](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp) for build failure on OCaml 5.3.0 ([ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1571](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1571)) and installation issue on Ubuntu 25.04 in [ocaml/merlin](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin) ([ocaml/merlin#1993](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1993)), both under investigation by [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos)
group_summaries.cross_repository_work:
- **Parameterized libraries support** coordination between [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) and [ocaml/odoc](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc): [Shon Feder](https://github.com/shonfeder) opened planning issue ([ocaml/odoc#1390](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1390)) for odoc to represent parameterized libraries, following Dune's extension to support parametric libraries via the oxcaml compiler, based on evaluation documented in [ocaml/dune#12565](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12565)
- **Package management ecosystem alignment**: [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) and [ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam) both advancing package management capabilities, with Dune's portable lockdirs ([ocaml/dune#12680](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12680)) and autolocking ([ocaml/dune#12653](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12653)) complementing opam 2.5.0~beta1 release stabilization
- **Developer tooling improvements**: [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) active across both [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) and [ocaml/ocaml-lsp](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp), contributing features and debugging support
- **Shared maintenance concerns**: [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) handling installation and compatibility issues in both [ocaml/merlin](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin) ([ocaml/merlin#1993](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1993)) and [ocaml/ocaml-lsp](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp) ([ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1571](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1571), [ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1572](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1572))
group_summaries.notable_discussions:
- **Concurrent builds proposal** in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) ([ocaml/dune#12731](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12731)) proposing removal of global build lock with claims of 2-5x faster IDE and 50% faster CI, generating debate about AI-assisted development and requiring team discussion with reference implementation in [ocaml/dune#12730](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12730)
- **Performance regression** in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) ([ocaml/dune#12693](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12693)) reported by [Shon Feder](https://github.com/shonfeder) showing 3 orders of magnitude slowdown in no-op builds with pkg (13s vs 850ms), requiring investigation
- **Portable lockdirs UX** in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) ([ocaml/dune#11868](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11868)) with extensive discussion by [Stephen Sherratt](https://github.com/gridbugs) and community about platform targeting strategies and proposal refinements
- **OpenSSL version upgrade problem** in [ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam) ([ocaml/opam#6736](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6736)) where system library updates from OpenSSL 3.5.2 to 3.6.0 break existing installations, with proposed solution to use `file-depends` feature in `conf-*` packages
- **Repository cache invalidation issue** in [ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam) ([ocaml/opam#6782](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6782)) after git package rename where first update uses stale state, highlighting broader concerns about version-equivalent package handling
- **Test organization discussion** in [ocaml/merlin](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin) ([ocaml/merlin#1994](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1994)) around efficiency and avoiding unnecessary file duplication in the test suite
group_summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Package management maturation** with both [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) and [ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam) focusing on production readiness: Dune enabling portable lockdirs ([ocaml/dune#12680](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12680)) and autolocking ([ocaml/dune#12653](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12653)) by default, while opam stabilizes 2.5.0 beta with critical bug fixes
- **Coq/Rocq ecosystem investment** in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) through CoqProject generation ([ocaml/dune#11752](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11752)), coqdoc customization ([ocaml/dune#11131](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11131)), bug fixes ([ocaml/dune#12733](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12733)), and Rocq 9.1.0 testing ([ocaml/dune#12734](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12734))
- **Performance optimization focus** across tools: [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) investigating regression ([ocaml/dune#12693](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12693)) and considering concurrent builds ([ocaml/dune#12731](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12731)), while [ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam) explores tar.gz direct usage ([ocaml/opam#6625](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6625)) and depext optimizations ([ocaml/opam#6489](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6489))
- **Developer experience improvements** in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) including better error messages ([ocaml/dune#12673](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12673), [ocaml/dune#12683](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12683)), location tracking ([ocaml/dune#12335](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12335), [ocaml/dune#12720](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12720)), unused library warnings ([ocaml/dune#12623](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12623)), and test introspection ([ocaml/dune#12545](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12545))
- **Testing infrastructure investment** with systematic closure of old bug reports through regression tests in [ocaml/merlin](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin) ([ocaml/merlin#1995](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1995), [ocaml/merlin#1996](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1996)) and cram test improvements in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) ([ocaml/dune#12335](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12335), [ocaml/dune#12720](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12720))
- **Build system modernization** with [ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam) removing external dependencies like cmdliner ([ocaml/opam#6755](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6755)) and improving error handling across build tooling ([ocaml/opam#6751](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6751))

group_summaries.brief_summary: Compiler work on modes system, SIMD intrinsics, and slambda IR with IDE tooling improvements in Merlin
group_summaries.new_features_summary: Shareable mode, slambda IR, SIMD load/store intrinsics, .cms file installation, and Merlin bug fixes
group_summaries.new_features:
- **Shareable mode** added to portability axis in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml), distinguishing functions that capture shared state and can execute in parallel from portable (contended) and nonportable (uncontended) functions ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4982](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4982))
- **Slambda intermediate representation** introduced in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) as new compilation phase between lambda and static evaluation, with `-dslambda` flag for debugging ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4776](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4776))
- **SIMD load/store intrinsics** for all SSE and AVX operations using memory operands in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml), including specialized handling for maskmovdqu with implicit RDI addressing ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4994](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4994), [oxcaml/oxcaml#4988](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4988))
- **Global implies aliased** constraint enforced syntactically in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml), preventing unsound `@@ global unique` combinations for future borrowing implementation ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4889](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4889))
- **Mode hints for containing** relationships added between containers (tuples, records, arrays) and their elements in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml), improving error messages ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4919](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4919))
- **Share context moved to mode hints** in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) through new `Is_used_in` hint and `Const_closure_lock`, replacing previous share_context mechanism ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4983](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4983))
- **Camlinternaleval shared JIT** in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) allowing mdx to reuse bindings across fragments without bundle mechanism ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4900](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4900), [oxcaml/oxcaml#4909](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4909), [oxcaml/oxcaml#4899](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4899))
- **Installation of .cms files** alongside .cmt files in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) for debug information and Merlin integration, adding 352 files (~4 MB) ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5005](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5005))
- **AFL instrumentation flags** support (`-afl-instrument` and `-afl-inst-ratio`) added to [oxcaml/merlin](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin) to enable fuzzing workflows without Merlin interference ([oxcaml/merlin#198](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/198))
- **Ghost location filtering** in syntax documentation for [oxcaml/merlin](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin) to fix spurious `[@nontail]` attribute hints from PPX-generated ghost nodes ([oxcaml/merlin#197](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/197))
- **Parameterized library crash prevention** in [oxcaml/merlin](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin) through proper handling of module name types and dependency tracking in short path analysis ([oxcaml/merlin#196](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/196))
group_summaries.group_overview:
- Primary activity concentrated in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) with 27 new PRs and substantial compiler infrastructure work spanning modes system, SIMD intrinsics, metaprogramming, and type system development
- [oxcaml/merlin](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin) delivered 3 bug fixes addressing parameterized libraries, syntax documentation accuracy, and fuzzing infrastructure compatibility
- [oxcaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository), [oxcaml/js_of_ocaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/js_of_ocaml), and [janestreet/opam-repository](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository) showed no activity this week
- Cross-repository coordination evident through .cms file installation in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) for Merlin integration and upstream OCaml collaboration on [ocaml/ocaml#13866](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13866)
group_summaries.activity_summary: 27 new PRs in oxcaml covering jkind normalization, probes, metaprogramming, GC optimizations, and debugging infrastructure
group_summaries.activity:
- **Type system advancement** in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) with unboxed module elements allowing non-value fields by [James Rayman](https://github.com/jra4) ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4020](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4020)), `Tof_jkind` for unboxed existentials by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4995](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4995)), pointerness as scannable axis by [Zack Eisbach](https://github.com/zackbach) ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5006](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5006)), and jkind normalization fuel increase to 10 with linear caching ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5009](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5009))
- **Metaprogramming infrastructure** development in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) through runtime metaprogramming extension by [Andrej Ivašković](https://github.com/Dreian) ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5012](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5012)) and metaprogramming review by [Jack Rickard](https://github.com/Skepfyr) ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4981](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4981))
- **Backend optimizations** in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) including x86 peephole optimization for dead register moves by [Xavier Clerc](https://github.com/xclerc) ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4985](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4985)), debug info ordering fix between `Name_for_debugger` and stack spilling by [Simon Spies](https://github.com/spiessimon) ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5013](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5013)), and major GC marking loop optimization by [Nick Barnes](https://github.com/NickBarnes) ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4997](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4997))
- **Probes implementation** advancing in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) with unoptimized probes by [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4991](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4991)) and [Greta Yorsh](https://github.com/gretay-js) ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5007](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5007)), probes refactoring ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5011](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5011)), and compile-time arch constants ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4972](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4972))
- **Debugging tooling** expansion in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) through LLDB OxCaml language plugin by [Simon Spies](https://github.com/spiessimon) ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4961](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4961)), function sections with DWARF support ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4934](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4934)), and reversible name mangling scheme by [Tim McGilchrist](https://github.com/tmcgilchrist) ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4850](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4850))
- **Metrics and CI improvements** in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) with per-artifact size tracking by [Xavier Clerc](https://github.com/xclerc) ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5003](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5003)), profile collection alongside artifact sizes ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5004](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5004)), and `-dump-dir` race condition fix ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5010](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5010))
- **Modes system refinement** in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) with crossing parsing support by [Zack Eisbach](https://github.com/zackbach) ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4781](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4781)), limited `mod contended` inference ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4929](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4929)), and arrays of GC-ignorable values by [@dkalinichenko-js](https://github.com/dkalinichenko-js) ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4963](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4963))
- **Upstream coordination** in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) with downstream of [ocaml/ocaml#13866](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13866) for `occur_rec` optimization by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5015](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5015)), collaborating with upstream fix from [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron)
group_summaries.cross_repository_work:
- **Merlin integration** coordinated between [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) and [oxcaml/merlin](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin) through .cms file installation alongside .cmt files for debug information ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5005](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5005)), enabling better IDE tooling support
- **Parameterized libraries** support improved in both [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) with unboxed module elements ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4020](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4020)) and [oxcaml/merlin](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin) with crash prevention fixes ([oxcaml/merlin#196](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/196))
- **Upstream OCaml collaboration** on [ocaml/ocaml#13866](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13866) with [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) providing the upstream `occur_rec` optimization that [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) is downstreaming to [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5015](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5015))
group_summaries.notable_discussions:
- **Upstream downstreaming coordination** on [oxcaml/oxcaml#5015](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5015) for [ocaml/ocaml#13866](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13866) involving [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) who provided the upstream fix that [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) is downstreaming, with [Richard Eisenberg](https://github.com/goldfirere) planning performance benchmarks
- **Mixed module implementation review** on [oxcaml/oxcaml#4020](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4020) for top-level unboxed elements with detailed discussions on module representations, coercions, parameterized libraries, and toplevel limitations between [James Rayman](https://github.com/jra4), [Vincent Laviron](https://github.com/lthls), [Chris Casinghino](https://github.com/ccasin), and [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell)
- **Jkind normalization approach** discussion on [oxcaml/oxcaml#4995](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4995) between [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) and [Richard Eisenberg](https://github.com/goldfirere) on using `Tof_jkind` versus tracking existentials, with questions about `fixed` parameter usage and type levels
- **GC-ignorable arrays semantics** clarification on [oxcaml/oxcaml#4963](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4963) between [@dkalinichenko-js](https://github.com/dkalinichenko-js) and [Vincent Laviron](https://github.com/lthls) regarding `caml_modify` skipping and scanner behavior for external values
- **Scannable axes design decisions** on [oxcaml/oxcaml#4992](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4992) between [Zack Eisbach](https://github.com/zackbach) and [Ryan Tjoa](https://github.com/rtjoa) covering warning messages, parsetree structure, CR conventions, and terminology choices for kind modifiers
group_summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Modes system maturation** evident through shareable mode addition ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4982](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4982)), mode hints refactoring ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4983](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4983)), crossing infrastructure ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4781](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4781)), and global-aliased constraints ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4889](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4889)) representing systematic expansion of the modes type system in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml)
- **SIMD intrinsics buildout** continuing with load/store operations ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4994](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4994)), memory operand generalization ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4988](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4988)), and addressing mode support showing commitment to complete SIMD instruction coverage in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml)
- **Metaprogramming infrastructure** development through slambda IR ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4776](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4776)), Camlinternaleval improvements ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4900](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4900)), translquote review ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4981](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4981)), and runtime metaprogramming extension ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5012](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5012)) indicating preparation for staged compilation in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml)
- **Type system sophistication** advancing with pointerness axes ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5006](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5006)), jkind normalization fuel increases ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5009](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5009)), unboxed module elements ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4020](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4020)), and GC-ignorable arrays ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4963](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4963)) extending layout expressiveness in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml)
- **Debugging tooling investment** through .cms file installation ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5005](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5005)), DWARF improvements ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4934](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4934)), name mangling ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4850](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4850)), and LLDB plugin ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4961](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4961)) demonstrating focus on developer experience across [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml)
- **Performance optimization efforts** spanning GC marking loops ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4997](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4997)), peephole optimizations ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4985](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4985)), and profile collection infrastructure ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5004](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5004)) showing attention to runtime efficiency in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml)
- **IDE tooling stability** improvements with parameterized library fixes ([oxcaml/merlin#196](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/196)), PPX ecosystem compatibility ([oxcaml/merlin#197](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/197)), and fuzzing infrastructure integration ([oxcaml/merlin#198](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/198)) in [oxcaml/merlin](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin)

group_summaries.brief_summary: String module extended with splitting functions, opam tooling enhanced, and runtime stability issues identified
group_summaries.new_features_summary: String.{take,drop,cut}_{first,last} functions added and opam configuration tooling improved
group_summaries.new_features:
- **String module splitting functions** added by [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) with `String.take_first`, `String.take_last`, `String.drop_first`, `String.drop_last`, `String.cut_first`, and `String.cut_last` to simplify string manipulation operations without manual index calculations ([ocaml/ocaml#14352](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14352))
- **Opam configuration tooling** enhanced by [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) with `ocaml-config.install` deployment script and historical compatibility support for system compilers ([ocaml/ocaml#14351](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14351))
- **C dependency generation** fixed in otherlibs build system by [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) to properly handle compilation dependencies ([ocaml/ocaml#14356](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14356))
- **Documentation formatting** corrected for polymorphic function parameters feature by [Bozhidar Batsov](https://github.com/bbatsov) ([ocaml/ocaml#14357](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14357))
group_summaries.group_overview:
- Activity concentrated entirely in [ocaml/ocaml](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml) with no activity in [ocaml/RFCs](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs) during this period
- Four PRs merged focusing on standard library extensions ([ocaml/ocaml#14352](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14352)), opam tooling ([ocaml/ocaml#14351](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14351)), build system fixes ([ocaml/ocaml#14356](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14356)), and documentation improvements ([ocaml/ocaml#14357](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14357))
- Seven new PRs opened covering String module extensions ([ocaml/ocaml#14362](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14362)), debugger enhancements ([ocaml/ocaml#14353](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14353)), and expanded opam system compiler support ([ocaml/ocaml#14354](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14354), [ocaml/ocaml#14355](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14355))
- Multiple runtime stability issues reported including Memprof segfaults ([ocaml/ocaml#14340](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14340), [ocaml/ocaml#14341](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14341)), ephemeron handling ([ocaml/ocaml#14349](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14349)), and domain shutdown problems ([ocaml/ocaml#14319](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14319))
- Ongoing work continues on relocatable OCaml installation capabilities with five active PRs by [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) ([ocaml/ocaml#14243](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14243), [ocaml/ocaml#14244](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14244), [ocaml/ocaml#14245](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14245), [ocaml/ocaml#14246](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14246), [ocaml/ocaml#14247](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14247))
group_summaries.activity_summary: String module predicate functions proposed, debugger improvements opened, and type system enhancements progressing
group_summaries.activity:
- **Extended String module predicate functions** proposed by [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) with `String.{take,drop,cut}_{first,last}_while` to complement the merged splitting functions ([ocaml/ocaml#14362](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14362))
- **Debugger usability enhancements** opened by [Joel Reymont](https://github.com/joelreymont) including command history and line editing support for ocamldebug ([ocaml/ocaml#14353](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14353))
- **Opam system compiler capabilities** expanded with PRs by [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) enabling trunk compiler installation ([ocaml/ocaml#14354](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14354)) and branch pinning ([ocaml/ocaml#14355](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14355))
- **Type system improvements** advancing with spellchecking hints for module errors by [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) ([ocaml/ocaml#14330](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14330)), atomic class cache access by [Vincent Laviron](https://github.com/lthls) ([ocaml/ocaml#14333](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14333)), and polymorphic let constraint handling by [Alistair](https://github.com/johnyob) ([ocaml/ocaml#14325](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14325))
- **Runtime fixes** progressing with ephemeron marking improvements by [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) ([ocaml/ocaml#14338](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14338)) and backup thread synchronization by [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) ([ocaml/ocaml#14303](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14303))
- **Platform integration** work continues with Haiku native backend activation by [Anarchos](https://github.com/Sylvain78) ([ocaml/ocaml#14138](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14138)) and typing recovery from Merlin by [Xavier Van de Woestyne](https://github.com/xvw) ([ocaml/ocaml#14241](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14241))
- **Termux/Android build issues** resolved with three issues closed after fixing getentropy and build system problems ([ocaml/ocaml#14087](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14087), [ocaml/ocaml#13380](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13380), [ocaml/ocaml#14346](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14346))
group_summaries.notable_discussions:
- **String module API design** discussion by [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) exploring improvements to string manipulation functions, directly related to the merged splitting functions and newly proposed predicate variants ([ocaml/ocaml#14137](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14137))
- **DLS API redesign** discussion by [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) examining potential improvements to domain-local storage mechanisms ([ocaml/ocaml#13356](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13356))
- **Repository maintenance** discussion about TODO.md documentation updates proposed by [@TimeForTypes](https://github.com/TimeForTypes) ([ocaml/ocaml#14361](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14361))
- **Domain backtrace inheritance** issue discussing whether `Printexc.record_backtrace true` should be inherited by new domains, with recent interest from [Nathan Taylor](https://github.com/dijkstracula) who offered to work on it ([ocaml/ocaml#12363](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/12363))
group_summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Standard library ergonomics** receiving focused attention through String module extensions that eliminate manual index calculations, building on community feedback about API usability from [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) ([ocaml/ocaml#14137](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14137))
- **Opam ecosystem integration** being strengthened with improved system compiler support, historical compatibility tracking, and relocatable installation capabilities to ease distribution and deployment ([ocaml/ocaml#14351](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14351), [ocaml/ocaml#14354](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14354), [ocaml/ocaml#14355](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14355))
- **Runtime robustness concerns** emerging with multiple segfault reports in Memprof by [Austin Theriault](https://github.com/ajbt200128) ([ocaml/ocaml#14340](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14340), [ocaml/ocaml#14341](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14341)), ephemeron handling by [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) ([ocaml/ocaml#14349](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14349)), and domain shutdown issues ([ocaml/ocaml#14319](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14319))
- **Developer tooling improvements** proposed including debugger command history by [Joel Reymont](https://github.com/joelreymont) ([ocaml/ocaml#14353](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14353)) and AI contribution guidelines discussion ([ocaml/ocaml#14052](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14052))

group_summaries.brief_summary: Proposal for new environment update API in Eio to support capability-based programming patterns
group_summaries.group_overview:
- Activity this week focused on [ocaml-multicore/eio](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio), with a new API proposal to improve ergonomics for capability-based programming
- [Patrick Ferris](https://github.com/patricoferris) proposed [ocaml-multicore/eio#823](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/pull/823) to add `Eio_unix.Stdenv.with_env` function for updating environments with modified capabilities
- [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) participated in design discussions, suggesting potential reconsideration of object-based APIs for Eio resources
- No activity was recorded in the other multicore repositories this week
group_summaries.activity_summary: Proposal for environment update function to enable swapping capabilities in subtyped environments
group_summaries.activity: - [Patrick Ferris](https://github.com/patricoferris) opened [ocaml-multicore/eio#823](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/pull/823) proposing `Eio_unix.Stdenv.with_env` function to address ergonomic challenges when using subtyped environment patterns, where programs define custom environment types extending `Eio_unix.Stdenv.t` and need to swap individual capabilities like process managers for debugging or testing
group_summaries.notable_discussions: - [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) commented on [ocaml-multicore/eio#823](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/pull/823) expressing interest in reconsidering object-based APIs for Eio resources, suggesting that object ergonomics may be superior to the current `Eio.Resource.T` API approach

weekly_summary.brief_summary: String module extended with splitting functions, opam 2.5.0~beta1 released, compiler advances with modes and SIMD, Eio environment API proposed
weekly_summary.new_features_summary: String splitting functions, opam 2.5.0~beta1, shareable mode, slambda IR, SIMD intrinsics, portable lockdirs, Merlin improvements
weekly_summary.new_features:
- __RUMINANT:core__ **String module splitting functions** added by [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) with `String.take_first`, `String.take_last`, `String.drop_first`, `String.drop_last`, `String.cut_first`, and `String.cut_last` to simplify string manipulation operations without manual index calculations [ocaml/ocaml#14352](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14352)
- __RUMINANT:core__ **Opam configuration tooling** enhanced by [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) with `ocaml-config.install` deployment script and historical compatibility support for system compilers [ocaml/ocaml#14351](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14351)
- __RUMINANT:core__ **C dependency generation** fixed in otherlibs build system by [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) to properly handle compilation dependencies [ocaml/ocaml#14356](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14356)
- __RUMINANT:core__ **Documentation formatting** corrected for polymorphic function parameters feature by [Bozhidar Batsov](https://github.com/bbatsov) [ocaml/ocaml#14357](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14357)
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **OPAM 2.5.0~beta1** released with 8 core packages (opam-client, opam-core, opam-devel, opam-format, opam-installer, opam-repository, opam-solver, opam-state) by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) [ocaml/opam-repository#28877](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28877), with changelog added to [ocaml/ocaml.org](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org) [ocaml/ocaml.org#3395](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/pull/3395), including dry-run mode fixes preventing switch directory creation [ocaml/opam#6540](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6540), macOS sandbox fixes allowing writes in `/var/folders/` and `/var/db/mds/` directories required by macOS core tools [ocaml/opam#4797](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/4797), and version-equivalent package rename bug fix [ocaml/opam#6774](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6774)
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ **Shareable mode** added to portability axis in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml), distinguishing functions that capture shared state and can execute in parallel from portable (contended) and nonportable (uncontended) functions [oxcaml/oxcaml#4982](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4982)
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ **Slambda intermediate representation** introduced in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) as new compilation phase between lambda and static evaluation, with `-dslambda` flag for debugging [oxcaml/oxcaml#4776](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4776)
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ **SIMD load/store intrinsics** for all SSE and AVX operations using memory operands in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml), including specialized handling for maskmovdqu with implicit RDI addressing [oxcaml/oxcaml#4994](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4994), [oxcaml/oxcaml#4988](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4988)
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ **Global implies aliased** constraint enforced syntactically in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml), preventing unsound `@@ global unique` combinations for future borrowing implementation [oxcaml/oxcaml#4889](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4889)
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ **Mode hints for containing** relationships added between containers (tuples, records, arrays) and their elements in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml), improving error messages [oxcaml/oxcaml#4919](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4919)
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ **Share context moved to mode hints** in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) through new `Is_used_in` hint and `Const_closure_lock`, replacing previous share_context mechanism [oxcaml/oxcaml#4983](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4983)
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ **Camlinternaleval shared JIT** in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) allowing mdx to reuse bindings across fragments without bundle mechanism [oxcaml/oxcaml#4900](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4900), [oxcaml/oxcaml#4909](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4909), [oxcaml/oxcaml#4899](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4899)
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ **Installation of .cms files** alongside .cmt files in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) for debug information and Merlin integration, adding 352 files (~4 MB) [oxcaml/oxcaml#5005](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5005)
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ **AFL instrumentation flags** support (`-afl-instrument` and `-afl-inst-ratio`) added to [oxcaml/merlin](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin) to enable fuzzing workflows without Merlin interference [oxcaml/merlin#198](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/198)
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ **Ghost location filtering** in syntax documentation for [oxcaml/merlin](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin) to fix spurious `[@nontail]` attribute hints from PPX-generated ghost nodes [oxcaml/merlin#197](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/197)
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ **Parameterized library crash prevention** in [oxcaml/merlin](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin) through proper handling of module name types and dependency tracking in short path analysis [oxcaml/merlin#196](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/196)
- __RUMINANT:tools__ **Portable lockdirs enabled by default** in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) by [Stephen Sherratt](https://github.com/gridbugs), making lock directories work across different platforms [ocaml/dune#12680](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12680)
- __RUMINANT:tools__ **Autolocking feature** in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter), allowing building package dependencies without running `dune pkg lock` first when `(pkg enabled)` is in dune-workspace [ocaml/dune#12653](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12653)
- __RUMINANT:tools__ **Unused libraries detection** via new `@unused-libs` alias in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) to detect unused library dependencies [ocaml/dune#12623](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12623)
- __RUMINANT:tools__ **New `dune describe tests` command** in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) by [Leitao -- Pereira Dias Rodrigue](https://github.com/Gromototo) providing comprehensive test metadata [ocaml/dune#12545](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12545)
- __RUMINANT:tools__ **Artifact variables `%{cmt:...}` and `%{cmti:...}`** in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) for referencing compiled annotation files with typed AST [ocaml/dune#12634](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12634)
- __RUMINANT:tools__ **PPX pform `%{ppx:lib1+..+libn}`** in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) for referring to ppx executables in tests [ocaml/dune#12711](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12711)
- __RUMINANT:tools__ **Package build progress enabled by default** in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) by [Puneeth Chaganti](https://github.com/punchagan), now respecting display settings [ocaml/dune#12695](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12695)
- __RUMINANT:tools__ **CoqProject file generation** in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) by [Rodolphe Lepigre](https://github.com/rlepigre) with opt-in `(generate_project_file)` in coq.theory stanza for better editor support [ocaml/dune#11752](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11752)
- __RUMINANT:tools__ **Coqdoc header and footer customization** in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) by [Rodolphe Lepigre](https://github.com/rlepigre) with new `coqdoc_header` and `coqdoc_footer` fields [ocaml/dune#11131](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11131)
- __RUMINANT:tools__ **Fixed runtime behavior** in [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml) for `target-env=browser` to eliminate erroneous `require("node:util")` and similar Node.js imports in browser-targeted builds [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml#2129](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2129)
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **Catala 1.0.0** legal programming language reached production milestone [ocaml/opam-repository#28853](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28853)
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **OCaml/Unikraft 1.1.0** adds support for OCaml 5.4.0 and Unikraft 0.20.0 with 19 updated packages [ocaml/opam-repository#28750](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28750)
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **Frama-C 32.0~beta** (Germanium) introduces ANSI color terminal support, improved C23 alignment directives, and new `\aligned` predicate in ACSL [ocaml/opam-repository#28842](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28842)
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **libdrm 0.1** initial release provides OCaml bindings for Direct Rendering Manager [ocaml/opam-repository#28883](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28883)
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **raga 0.1.0** new static site generator with Handlebars templating by [Kaustubh Maske Patil](https://github.com/nikochiko) [ocaml/opam-repository#28847](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28847)
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **handlebars-ml 0.3.0** brings Handlebars.js templating to OCaml [ocaml/opam-repository#28846](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28846)
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **jsonfeed 1.1.0** parser for JSON Feed specification by [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) [ocaml/opam-repository#28884](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28884)
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **crockford 1.0.0** implements Crockford Base32 encoding [ocaml/opam-repository#28885](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28885)
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **tsdl 1.2.0** adds preferred locales support and message box fixes for SDL2 bindings [ocaml/opam-repository#28878](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28878)
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **ctypes 0.24.0** foreign function interface library update [ocaml/opam-repository#28855](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28855)
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **patch 3.1.0** performance improvements using rope data structure [ocaml/opam-repository#28854](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28854)
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **moonpool 0.10** thread/domain pools with breaking changes (removed `around_task` and `moonpool.fib`) [ocaml/opam-repository#28891](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28891)
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **ansifmt 2.0.0** complete rewrite using rich-string for ANSI terminal styling [ocaml/opam-repository#28803](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28803)
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **visitors.20251114** syntax extension for generating visitor classes by [François Pottier](https://github.com/fpottier) [ocaml/opam-repository#28893](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28893)
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **Binaryen WebAssembly tooling** with 9 packages released: libbinaryen 122.0.1, 123.0.1, 124.0.1 and binaryen 0.32.0, 0.33.0, 0.34.0 by [Oscar Spencer](https://github.com/ospencer) [ocaml/opam-repository#28859](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28859), [ocaml/opam-repository#28860](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28860), [ocaml/opam-repository#28861](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28861), [ocaml/opam-repository#28880](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28880), [ocaml/opam-repository#28887](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28887), [ocaml/opam-repository#28888](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28888)
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **logs 0.10.0** logging library update, **bytesrw 0.3.0** bytes readers and writers library, **bitstring 5.0.2** pattern matching for binary data, **directories 0.7** platform-appropriate standard directories, and **elpi 3.4.3** embeddable lambda-Prolog interpreter merged

oxcaml: -**Shareable mode** added to portability axis in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml), distinguishing functions that capture shared state and can execute in parallel from portable (contended) and nonportable (uncontended) functions [oxcaml/oxcaml#4982](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4982)

-**Slambda intermediate representation** introduced in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) as new compilation phase between lambda and static evaluation, with `-dslambda` flag for debugging [oxcaml/oxcaml#4776](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4776)

-**SIMD load/store intrinsics** for all SSE and AVX operations using memory operands in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml), including specialized handling for maskmovdqu with implicit RDI addressing [oxcaml/oxcaml#4994](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4994), [oxcaml/oxcaml#4988](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4988)

-**Global implies aliased** constraint enforced syntactically in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml), preventing unsound `@@ global unique` combinations for future borrowing implementation [oxcaml/oxcaml#4889](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4889)

-**Mode hints for containing** relationships added between containers (tuples, records, arrays) and their elements in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml), improving error messages [oxcaml/oxcaml#4919](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4919)

-**Share context moved to mode hints** in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) through new `Is_used_in` hint and `Const_closure_lock`, replacing previous share_context mechanism [oxcaml/oxcaml#4983](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4983)

-**Camlinternaleval shared JIT** in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) allowing mdx to reuse bindings across fragments without bundle mechanism [oxcaml/oxcaml#4900](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4900), [oxcaml/oxcaml#4909](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4909), [oxcaml/oxcaml#4899](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4899)

-**Installation of .cms files** alongside .cmt files in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) for debug information and Merlin integration, adding 352 files (~4 MB) [oxcaml/oxcaml#5005](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5005)

-**AFL instrumentation flags** support (`-afl-instrument` and `-afl-inst-ratio`) added to [oxcaml/merlin](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin) to enable fuzzing workflows without Merlin interference [oxcaml/merlin#198](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/198)

-**Ghost location filtering** in syntax documentation for [oxcaml/merlin](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin) to fix spurious `[@nontail]` attribute hints from PPX-generated ghost nodes [oxcaml/merlin#197](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/197)

-**Parameterized library crash prevention** in [oxcaml/merlin](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin) through proper handling of module name types and dependency tracking in short path analysis [oxcaml/merlin#196](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/196)

weekly_summary.group_overview:
- __RUMINANT:core__ Activity concentrated entirely in [ocaml/ocaml](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml) with no activity in [ocaml/RFCs](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs) during this period, with four PRs merged focusing on standard library extensions [ocaml/ocaml#14352](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14352), opam tooling [ocaml/ocaml#14351](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14351), build system fixes [ocaml/ocaml#14356](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14356), and documentation improvements [ocaml/ocaml#14357](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14357), while seven new PRs opened covering String module extensions, debugger enhancements, and expanded opam system compiler support, with multiple runtime stability issues reported including Memprof segfaults, ephemeron handling, and domain shutdown problems
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ Primary activity concentrated in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) with 27 new PRs and three merged bug fixes in [oxcaml/merlin](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin), with development spanning modes system through shareable mode [oxcaml/oxcaml#4982](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4982) and mode hints refactoring [oxcaml/oxcaml#4983](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4983), SIMD intrinsics buildout with load/store operations [oxcaml/oxcaml#4994](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4994) and memory operands [oxcaml/oxcaml#4988](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4988), metaprogramming infrastructure through slambda IR [oxcaml/oxcaml#4776](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4776) and Camlinternaleval improvements [oxcaml/oxcaml#4900](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4900), type system advancement with pointerness axes [oxcaml/oxcaml#5006](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5006) and jkind normalization fuel increases [oxcaml/oxcaml#5009](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5009), debugging tooling investment through .cms file installation [oxcaml/oxcaml#5005](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5005) and LLDB plugin [oxcaml/oxcaml#4961](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4961), performance optimization with GC marking loops [oxcaml/oxcaml#4997](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4997) and peephole optimizations [oxcaml/oxcaml#4985](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4985), and IDE tooling stability improvements through parameterized library fixes [oxcaml/merlin#196](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/196), PPX ecosystem compatibility [oxcaml/merlin#197](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/197), and fuzzing infrastructure integration [oxcaml/merlin#198](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/198)
- __RUMINANT:multicore__ Activity this week focused on [ocaml-multicore/eio](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio), with a new API proposal [ocaml-multicore/eio#823](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/pull/823) by [Patrick Ferris](https://github.com/patricoferris) to add `Eio_unix.Stdenv.with_env` function for updating environments with modified capabilities, with [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) participating in design discussions suggesting potential reconsideration of object-based APIs for Eio resources, while no activity was recorded in the other multicore repositories this week
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ The ecosystem group coordinated the **OPAM 2.5.0~beta1 release** across [ocaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository) [ocaml/opam-repository#28877](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28877) and [ocaml/ocaml.org](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org) [ocaml/ocaml.org#3395](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/pull/3395), with [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) releasing 8 core packages and documenting the release on the website, with **43 packages merged** in [ocaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository) spanning infrastructure tools, WebAssembly tooling, data format libraries, web development frameworks, and specialized domain applications, with **cross-platform improvements** delivered through MSYS2/Cygwin CI fixes [ocaml/opam-repository#28897](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28897), [ocaml/opam-repository#28856](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28856), OCaml/Unikraft 1.1.0 unikernel support [ocaml/opam-repository#28750](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28750), and Android/Termux support discussions [ocaml/opam-repository#28871](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28871), with **beta testing cycle** underway including OPAM 2.5.0~beta1, Lwt 6.0.0-beta01 [ocaml/opam-repository#28894](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28894), and Frama-C 32.0~beta [ocaml/opam-repository#28842](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28842)
- __RUMINANT:tools__ [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) saw activity with package management features reaching production readiness through portable lockdirs [ocaml/dune#12680](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12680) and autolocking [ocaml/dune#12653](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12653) enabled by default, plus Coq/Rocq ecosystem investment and developer experience improvements, while [ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam) released version 2.5.0~beta1 with fixes for dry-run mode [ocaml/opam#6540](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6540), macOS sandbox [ocaml/opam#4797](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/4797), and package rename handling [ocaml/opam#6774](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6774), with [ocaml/merlin](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin) focusing on test suite expansion with regression tests [ocaml/merlin#1995](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1995), [ocaml/merlin#1996](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1996), [ocaml/odoc](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc) initiating planning for parameterized libraries documentation support [ocaml/odoc#1390](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1390), [ocaml/ocaml-lsp](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp) handling dependency compatibility questions [ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1572](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1572) and installation troubleshooting [ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1571](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1571), and [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml) fixing browser target runtime issue [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml#2129](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2129)
